intro: Tetranthera timoriana, commonly known as the Timor tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with smooth margins and a slightly hairy texture. Tetranthera timoriana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
